00018   array set mode            {}

00025   ######################################################################
00026   # Enables/disables Vim mode for all text widgets.
00027   proc set_vim_mode_all {} {
00028  
00029     variable command_entries
00030 
00031     # Set the Vim mode on all text widgets
00032     foreach txt [array names command_entries] {
00033       if {[winfo exists $txt]} {
00034         set_vim_mode [winfo parent $txt] {}  ;# TBD
00035       } else {
00036         unset command_entries($txt)
00037       }
00038     }
00039     
00040   }
00041   
00042   ######################################################################
00043   # Enables/disables Vim mode for the specified text widget.
00044   proc set_vim_mode {txt tid} {
00045 
00046     if {[[ns preferences]::get Tools/VimMode]} {
00047       add_bindings $txt $tid
00048     } else {
00049       remove_bindings $txt
00050     }
00051     
00052   }

00054   ######################################################################
00055   # Returns 1 if we are currently in non-edit vim mode; otherwise,
00056   # returns 0.
00057   proc in_vim_mode {txt} {
00058     
00059     variable mode
00060     
00061     if {[[ns preferences]::get Tools/VimMode] && \
00062         [info exists mode($txt)] && \
00063         ($mode($txt) ne "edit")} {
00064       return 1
00065     } else {
00066       return 0
00067     }
00068     
00069   }
00070   
00071   ######################################################################
00072   # Returns the current Vim mode for the editor.
00073   proc get_mode {txt} {
00074     
00075     variable mode
00076     
00077     if {[[ns preferences]::get Tools/VimMode]} {
00078       if {[info exists mode($txt.t)] && ($mode($txt.t) eq "edit")} {
00079         return "INSERT MODE"
00080       } elseif {[info exists mode($txt.t)] && ($mode($txt.t) eq "visual")} {
00081         return "VISUAL MODE"
00082       } else {
00083         return "COMMAND MODE"
00084       }
00085     } else {
00086       return ""
00087     }
00088     
00089   }

00091   ######################################################################
00092   # Binds the given entry 
00093   proc bind_command_entry {txt entry tid} {
00094   
00095     variable command_entries
00096     
00097     # Save the entry
00098     set command_entries($txt.t) $entry
00099   
00100     bind $entry <Return>    "[ns vim]::handle_command_return %W {$tid}"
00101     bind $entry <Escape>    "[ns vim]::handle_command_escape %W {$tid}"
00102     bind $entry <BackSpace> "[ns vim]::handle_command_backspace %W {$tid}"
00103   
00104   }
00105   
00106   ######################################################################
00107   # Handles the command entry text.
00108   proc handle_command_return {w tid} {
00109       
00110     # Get the last txt widget that had the focus
00111     set txt [[ns gui]::last_txt_focus $tid]
00112     
00113     # Get the value from the command field
00114     set value [$w get]
00115     
00116     # Delete the value in the command entry
00117     $w delete 0 end
00118     
00119     # Execute the command
00120     switch -- $value {
00121       w  { [ns gui]::save_current $tid }
00122       w! { [ns gui]::save_current $tid }
00123       wq { [ns gui]::save_current $tid; [ns gui]::close_current }
00124       q  { [ns gui]::close_current $tid 0; set txt "" }
00125       q! { [ns gui]::close_current $tid 1; set txt "" }
00126       e! { [ns gui]::update_current }
00127       n  { [ns gui]::next_tab }
00128       N  { [ns gui]::previous_tab }
00129       p  { after idle [ns gui]::next_pane }
00130       e\# { [ns gui]::last_tab }
00131       m  {
00132         set line [lindex [split [$txt index insert] .] 0]
00133         [ns markers]::delete_by_line $txt $line
00134         ctext::linemapClearMark $txt $line
00135       }
00136       default {
00137         catch {
00138           if {[regexp {^(\d+|[.^$]|\w+),(\d+|[.^$]|\w+)s/(.*)/(.*)/(g?)$} $value -> from to search replace glob]} {
00139             set from [get_linenum $txt $from]
00140             set to   [$txt index "[get_linenum $txt $to] lineend-1c"]
00141             [ns gui]::do_raw_search_and_replace $tid $from $to $search $replace 0 [expr {$glob eq "g"}]
00142           } elseif {[regexp {^(\d+|[.^$]|\w+),(\d+|[.^$]|\w+)([dy])$} $value -> from to cmd]} {
00143             set from [get_linenum $txt $from]
00144             set to   [$txt index "[get_linenum $txt $to] lineend"]
00145             clipboard clear
00146             clipboard append [$txt get $from $to]
00147             if {$cmd eq "d"} {
00148               $txt delete $from $to
00149               adjust_insert $txt.t
00150             }
00151             cliphist::add_from_clipboard
00152           } elseif {[regexp {^(\d+|[.^$]|\w+)$} $value]} {
00153             $txt mark set insert [get_linenum $txt $value]
00154             adjust_insert $txt.t
00155             $txt see insert
00156           } elseif {[regexp {^(\d+|[.^$]|\w+),(\d+|[.^$]|\w+)c/(.*)/$} $value -> from to search]} {
00157             set from [get_linenum $txt $from]
00158             set to   [$txt index "[get_linenum $txt $to] lineend"]
00159             [ns multicursor]::search_and_add_cursors $txt $from $to $search
00160           } elseif {[regexp {^(\d+|[.^$]|\w+),(\d+|[.^$]|\w+)w(!)?\s+(.*)$} $value -> from to overwrite fname]} {
00161             set from [get_linenum $txt $from]
00162             set to   [get_linenum $txt $to]
00163             if {($overwrite eq "") && [file exists $fname]} {
00164               [ns gui]::set_info_message "Filename $fname already exists"
00165             } else {
00166               if {[catch { open $fname w } rc]} {
00167                 [ns gui]::set_info_message "Unable to open $fname for writing"
00168               } else {
00169                 puts $rc [$txt get "$from linestart" "$to lineend"]
00170                 close $rc
00171                 [ns gui]::set_info_message "File $fname successfully written"
00172               }
00173             }
00174           } elseif {[regexp {^e\s+(.*)$} $value -> filename]} {
00175             [ns gui]::add_file end [normalize_filename [[ns utils]::perform_substitutions $filename]]
00176           } elseif {[regexp {^w\s+(.*)$} $value -> filename]} {
00177             [ns gui]::save_current $tid [normalize_filename [[ns utils]::perform_substitutions $filename]]
00178           } elseif {[regexp {^m\s+(.*)$} $value -> marker]} {
00179             set line [lindex [split [$txt index insert] .] 0]
00180             if {$marker ne ""} {
00181               [ns markers]::add $txt [$txt index insert] $marker
00182               ctext::linemapSetMark $txt $line
00183             } else {
00184               [ns markers]::delete_by_line $txt $line
00185               ctext::linemapClearMark $txt $line
00186             }
00187           } elseif {[regexp {^r\s+(.*)$} $value -> filename]} {
00188             [ns vim]::insert_file $txt [normalize_filename [[ns utils]::perform_substitutions $filename]]
00189           } elseif {[regexp {^cd\s+(.*)$} $value -> directory]} {
00190             set directory [[ns utils]::perform_substitutions $directory]
00191             if {[file isdirectory $directory]} {
00192               cd $directory
00193               [ns gui]::set_title
00194             }
00195           }
00196         }
00197       }
00198     }
00199     
00200     # Remove the grab
00201     grab release $w
00202     
00203     if {$txt ne ""} {
00204       
00205       # Set the focus back to the text widget
00206       [ns gui]::set_txt_focus $txt
00207     
00208       # Hide the command entry widget
00209       grid remove $w 
00210       
00211     }
00212   
00213   }
00214   
00215   ######################################################################
00216   # Normalizes the given filename string, performing any environment
00217   # variable substitutions.
00218   proc normalize_filename {file_str} {
00219     
00220     while {[regexp -indices {(\$(\w+))} $file_str -> str var]} {
00221       set var [string range $file_str {*}$var]
00222       if {[info exists ::env($var)]} {
00223         set file_str [string replace $file_str {*}$str $::env($var)]
00224       } else {
00225         return -code error "Environment variable $var does not exist"
00226       }
00227     }
00228     
00229     return [file normalize $file_str]
00230     
00231   }
00232   
00233   ######################################################################
00234   # Inserts the given file contents beneath the current insertion line.
00235   proc insert_file {txt filename} {
00236     
00237     if {![catch "open $filename r" rc]} {
00238       
00239       # Read the contents of the file and close the file
00240       set contents [read $rc]
00241       close $rc
00242       
00243       # Insert the file contents beneath the current insertion line
00244       $txt insert "insert lineend" "\n$contents"
00245       
00246       # Adjust the insert cursor
00247       adjust_insert $txt
00248       
00249     }
00250     
00251   }
00252   
00253   ######################################################################
00254   # Adjust the current selection if we are in visual mode.
00255   proc adjust_select {txt index} {
00256     
00257     variable select_anchors
00258     
00259     # Get the anchor for the given selection
00260     set anchor [lindex $select_anchors($txt) $index]
00261     
00262     if {[$txt compare $anchor < insert]} {
00263       $txt tag add sel $anchor insert
00264     } else {
00265       $txt tag add sel insert $anchor
00266     }
00267     
00268   }

00270   ######################################################################
00271   # Handles an escape key in the command entry widget.
00272   proc handle_command_escape {w tid} {
00273     
00274     # Get the last text widget that had focus
00275     set txt [[ns gui]::last_txt_focus $tid]
00276     
00277     # Delete the value in the command entry
00278     $w delete 0 end
00279     
00280     # Remove the grab and set the focus back to the text widget
00281     grab release $w
00282     [ns gui]::set_txt_focus $txt
00283     
00284     # Hide the command entry widget
00285     grid remove $w
00286     
00287   }
00288   
00289   ######################################################################
00290   # Handles a backspace key in the command entry widget.
00291   proc handle_command_backspace {w tid} {
00292  
00293     if {[$w get] eq ""} {
00294       
00295       # Remove the grab and set the focus back to the text widget
00296       grab release $w
00297       [ns gui]::set_txt_focus [[ns gui]::last_txt_focus $tid]
00298       
00299       # Hide the command entry widget
00300       grid remove $w
00301       
00302     }
00303   
00304   }

00306   ######################################################################
00307   # Returns the line number based on the given line number character.
00308   proc get_linenum {txt char} {
00309     
00310     if {$char eq "."} {
00311       return [$txt index "insert linestart"]
00312     } elseif {$char eq "^"} {
00313       return "1.0"
00314     } elseif {$char eq "$"} {
00315       return [$txt index "end linestart"]
00316     } elseif {[set index [[ns markers]::get_index $txt $char]] ne ""} {
00317       return [$txt index "$index linestart"]
00318     } elseif {[regexp {^\d+$} $char]} {
00319       return "$char.0"
00320     } else {
00321       return -code error "$char is not a valid marker name"
00322     }
00323     
00324   }
00325   
00326   ######################################################################
00327   # Add Vim bindings 
00328   proc add_bindings {txt tid} {
00329     
00330     variable mode
00331     variable number
00332     variable ignore_modified
00333     variable column
00334     variable select_anchors
00335     
00336     # Change the cursor to the block cursor
00337     $txt configure -blockcursor true
00338     
00339     # Put ourselves into start mode
00340     set mode($txt.t)           "start"
00341     set number($txt.t)         ""
00342     set search_dir($txt.t)     "next"
00343     set ignore_modified($txt)  0
00344     set column($txt.t)         ""
00345     set select_anchors($txt.t) [list]
00346     
00347     # Add bindings
00348     bind $txt       <<Modified>>      "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_modified %W\]} { break }"
00349     bind vim$txt    <Escape>          "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_escape %W\]} { break }"
00350     bind vim$txt    <Any-Key>         "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_any %W {$tid} %K %A\]} { break }"
00351     bind vim$txt    <Button-1>        "[ns vim]::handle_button1 %W %x %y; break"
00352     bind vim$txt    <Double-Button-1> "[ns vim]::handle_double_button1 %W %x %y; break"
00353     bind vim$txt    <B1-Motion>       "[ns vim]::handle_motion %W %x %y; break"
00354     bind vimpre$txt <Control-f>       "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_control_f %W\]} { break }"
00355     bind vimpre$txt <Control-b>       "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_control_b %W\]} { break }"
00356     bind vimpre$txt <Control-g>       "if {\[[ns vim]::handle_control_g %W\]} { break }"
00357     
00358     # Insert the vimpre binding just prior to all
00359     set all_index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] all]
00360     bindtags $txt.t [linsert [bindtags $txt.t] $all_index vimpre$txt]
00361     
00362     # Insert the vim binding just prior to Text    
00363     set text_index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] Text]
00364     bindtags $txt.t [linsert [bindtags $txt.t] $text_index vim$txt]
00365     
00366     # Put ourselves into start mode
00367     start_mode $txt.t
00368  
00369   }
00370   
00371   ######################################################################
00372   # Handles a modified event when in Vim mode.
00373   proc handle_modified {W} {
00374 
00375     variable ignore_modified
00376 
00377     if {[info exists ignore_modified($W)] && $ignore_modified($W)} {
00378       set ignore_modified($W) 0
00379       $W edit modified false
00380       return 1
00381     }
00382 
00383     return 0
00384 
00385   }

00387   ######################################################################
00388   # Handles a left-click event when in Vim mode.
00389   proc handle_button1 {W x y} {
00390     
00391     $W tag remove sel 1.0 end
00392     
00393     set current [$W index @$x,$y]
00394     $W mark set [[ns utils]::text_anchor $W] $current
00395     $W mark set insert $current
00396     
00397     if {[set [ns vim]::mode($W)] ne "edit"} {
00398       adjust_insert $W
00399     }
00400     
00401     focus $W
00402     
00403   }
00404   
00405   ######################################################################
00406   # Handles a double-left-click event when in Vim mode.
00407   proc handle_double_button1 {W x y} {
00408     
00409     $W tag remove sel 1.0 end
00410     
00411     set current [$W index @$x,$y]
00412     $W tag add sel [$W index "$current wordstart"] [$W index "$current wordend"]
00413     $W mark set insert [$W index "$current wordstart"]
00414     
00415     focus $W
00416     
00417   }
00418   
00419   ######################################################################
00420   # Handle left-button hold motion event when in Vim mode.
00421   proc handle_motion {W x y} {
00422     
00423     $W tag remove sel 1.0 end
00424     
00425     set current [$W index @$x,$y]
00426     $W tag add sel [[ns utils]::text_anchor $W] $current
00427     $W mark set insert $current
00428     
00429     if {[set [ns vim]::mode($W)] ne "edit"} {
00430       adjust_insert $W
00431     }
00432     
00433     focus $W
00434       
00435   }

00437   ######################################################################
00438   # Remove the Vim bindings on the text widget.
00439   proc remove_bindings {txt} {
00440     
00441     # Remove the vim* bindings from the widget
00442     if {[set index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] vim$txt]] != -1} {
00443       bindtags $txt.t [lreplace [bindtags $txt.t] $index $index]
00444     }
00445     
00446     # Remove the vimpre* bindings from the widget
00447     if {[set index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] vimpre$txt]] != -1} {
00448       bindtags $txt.t [lreplace [bindtags $txt.t] $index $index]
00449     }
00450     
00451     # Move $txt.t <<Modified>> binding back to $txt
00452     bind $txt <<Modified>> ""
00453     
00454     # Change the cursor to the insertion cursor
00455     $txt configure -blockcursor false
00456     
00457   }
00458   
00459   ######################################################################
00460   # Set the current mode to the "edit" mode.
00461   proc edit_mode {txt} {
00462     
00463     variable mode
00464     
00465     # Set the mode to the edit mode
00466     set mode($txt) "edit"
00467  
00468     # Set the blockcursor to false
00469     $txt configure -blockcursor false
00470  
00471     # If the current cursor is on a dummy space, remove it
00472     set tags [$txt tag names insert]
00473     if {([lsearch $tags "dspace"] != -1) && ([lsearch $tags "mcursor"] == -1)} {
00474       $txt delete insert
00475     }
00476  
00477   }
00478  
00479   ######################################################################
00480   # Set the current mode to the "start" mode.
00481   proc start_mode {txt} {
00482  
00483     variable mode
00484     
00485     # If we are going from the edit state to the start state, add a separator
00486     # to the undo stack.
00487     if {$mode($txt) eq "edit"} {
00488       $txt edit separator
00489 
00490     # If we are coming from visual mode, clear the selection
00491     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "visual"} {
00492       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
00493     }
00494     
00495     # If were in the edit or replace_all state, move the insertion cursor back
00496     # one character.
00497     if {(($mode($txt) eq "edit") || ($mode($txt) eq "replace_all")) && \
00498         ([$txt index insert] ne [$txt index "insert linestart"])} {
00499       $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
00500     }
00501 
00502     # Set the current mode to the start mode
00503     set mode($txt) "start"
00504     
00505     # Set the blockcursor to true
00506     $txt configure -blockcursor true
00507     
00508     # Adjust the insertion marker
00509     adjust_insert $txt
00510  
00511   }
00512   
00513   ######################################################################
00514   # Set the current mode to the "visual" mode.
00515   proc visual_mode {txt} {
00516     
00517     variable mode
00518     variable select_anchors
00519     
00520     # Set the current mode
00521     set mode($txt) "visual"
00522     
00523     # Clear the current selection
00524     $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
00525     
00526     # Initialize the select range
00527     set select_anchors($txt) [$txt index insert]
00528     
00529   }

00531   ######################################################################
00532   # Starts recording keystrokes.
00533   proc record_start {} {
00534     
00535     variable record_mode
00536     variable recording
00537     
00538     if {$record_mode eq "none"} {
00539       set record_mode "record"
00540       set recording   [list]
00541     }
00542     
00543   }
00544   
00545   ######################################################################
00546   # Stops recording keystrokes.
00547   proc record_stop {} {
00548     
00549     variable record_mode
00550     
00551     if {$record_mode eq "record"} {
00552       set record_mode "none"
00553     }
00554     
00555   }

00557   ######################################################################
00558   # Records a signal event and stops recording.
00559   proc record {event} {
00560     
00561     variable record_mode
00562     variable recording
00563     
00564     if {$record_mode eq "none"} {
00565       set recording $event
00566     }
00567     
00568   }
00569   
00570   ######################################################################
00571   # Adds an event to the recording buffer if we are in record mode.
00572   proc record_add {event} {
00573     
00574     variable record_mode
00575     variable recording
00576     
00577     if {$record_mode eq "record"} {
00578       lappend recording $event
00579     }
00580     
00581   }
00582   
00583   ######################################################################
00584   # Plays back the record buffer.
00585   proc playback {txt} {
00586     
00587     variable record_mode
00588     variable recording
00589 
00590     # Set the record mode to playback
00591     set record_mode "playback"
00592     
00593     # Replay the recording buffer
00594     foreach event $recording {
00595       eval "event generate $txt <$event>"
00596     }
00597     
00598     # Set the record mode to none
00599     set record_mode "none"
00600     
00601   }
00602   
00603   ######################################################################
00604   # Stops recording and clears the recording array.
00605   proc record_clear {} {
00606     
00607     variable record_mode
00608     variable recording
00609     
00610     set record_mode "none"
00611     set recording   [list]
00612     
00613   }
00614   
00615   ######################################################################
00616   # Adjust the insertion marker so that it never is allowed to sit on
00617   # the lineend spot.
00618   proc adjust_insert {txt} {
00619   
00620     variable mode
00621     variable ignore_modified
00622     
00623     # Remove any existing dspace characters
00624     cleanup_dspace [winfo parent $txt]
00625     
00626     # If the current line contains nothing, add a dummy space so that the
00627     # block cursor doesn't look dumb.
00628     if {[$txt index "insert linestart"] eq [$txt index "insert lineend"]} {
00629       set ignore_modified([winfo parent $txt]) 1
00630       $txt fastinsert insert " " dspace
00631       $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
00632       
00633     # Make sure that lineend is never the insertion point
00634     } elseif {[$txt index insert] eq [$txt index "insert lineend"]} {
00635       $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
00636     }
00637     
00638     # Adjust the selection (if we are in visual mode)
00639     if {$mode($txt) eq "visual"} {
00640       adjust_select $txt 0
00641     }
00642     
00643   }
00644   
00645   ######################################################################
00646   # Cleans up the dspace.
00647   proc cleanup_dspace {w} {
00648 
00649     variable ignore_modified
00650       
00651     foreach {endpos startpos} [lreverse [$w tag ranges dspace]] {
00652       if {[lsearch [$w tag names $startpos] "mcursor"] == -1} {
00653         set ignore_modified($w) 1
00654         $w fastdelete $startpos $endpos
00655       }
00656     }
00657 
00658   }
00659  
00660   ######################################################################
00661   # Returns the contents of the given text widget without the injected
00662   # dspaces.
00663   proc get_cleaned_content {txt} {
00664   
00665     set str ""
00666     set last_startpos 1.0
00667     
00668     # Remove any dspace characters
00669     foreach {startpos endpos} [$txt tag ranges dspace] {
00670       append str [$txt get $last_startpos $startpos]
00671       set last_startpos $endpos
00672     }
00673     
00674     append str [$txt get $last_startpos "end-1c"]
00675     
00676     return $str
00677     
00678   }
00679   
00680   ######################################################################
00681   # Handles the escape-key when in Vim mode.
00682   proc handle_escape {txt} {
00683     
00684     variable mode
00685     variable number
00686     
00687     if {$mode($txt) ne "start"} {
00688       
00689       # Add to the recording if we are doing so
00690       record_add Escape
00691       record_stop
00692       
00693       # Set the mode to start
00694       start_mode $txt
00695       
00696     } else {
00697       
00698       # If were in start mode, clear the recording buffer
00699       record_clear
00700       
00701     }
00702     
00703     # Clear the current number string
00704     set number($txt) ""
00705 
00706     return 1
00707     
00708   }
00709   
00710   ######################################################################
00711   # Handles any single printable character.
00712   proc handle_any {txt tid keysym char} {
00713 
00714     variable mode
00715     variable number
00716     variable column
00717     
00718     # If the keysym is the shift key, stop
00719     if {($keysym eq "Shift_L") || ($keysym eq "Shift_R")} {
00720       return 1
00721     }
00722     
00723     # If the keysym is neither j or k, clear the column
00724     if {($keysym ne "j") && ($keysym ne "k")} {
00725       set column($txt) ""
00726     }
00727     
00728     # If we are not in edit mode
00729     if {![catch "handle_$keysym $txt {$tid}" rc] && $rc} {
00730       record_add "Key-$keysym"
00731       if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00732         set number($txt) ""
00733       }
00734       return 1
00735     } elseif {[string is integer $keysym] && [handle_number $txt $char]} {
00736       record_add "Key-$keysym"
00737       return 1
00738     } elseif {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
00739       return 1
00740     }
00741     
00742     record_add "Key-$keysym"
00743 
00744     # Append the text to the insertion buffer
00745     if {[string equal -length 7 $mode($txt) "replace"]} {
00746       $txt replace insert "insert+1c" $char
00747       $txt highlight "insert linestart" "insert lineend"
00748       if {$mode($txt) eq "replace"} {
00749         $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
00750         start_mode $txt
00751         record_stop
00752       }
00753       return 1
00754       
00755     # Remove all text within the current character
00756     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "changein"} {
00757       if {([set start_index [$txt search -backwards $char insert 1.0]] ne "") && \
00758           ([set end_index   [$txt search -forwards  $char insert end]] ne "")} {
00759         $txt delete $start_index+1c $end_index
00760         edit_mode $txt
00761       } else {
00762         start_mode $txt
00763       }
00764       return 1
00765     }
00766     
00767     return 0
00768         
00769   }
00770   
00771   ######################################################################
00772   # If we are in "start" mode, the number is 0 and the current number
00773   # is empty, set the insertion cursor to the beginning of the line;
00774   # otherwise, append the number current to number value.
00775   proc handle_number {txt num} {
00776   
00777     variable mode
00778     variable number
00779     
00780     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
00781       if {($mode($txt) eq "start") && ($num eq "0") && ($number($txt) eq "")} {
00782         $txt mark set insert "insert linestart"
00783         $txt see insert
00784       } else {
00785         append number($txt) $num
00786         record_start
00787       }
00788       return 1
00789     }
00790     
00791     return 0
00792   
00793   }
00794   
00795   ######################################################################
00796   # If we are in the "start" mode, display the command entry field and
00797   # give it the focus.
00798   proc handle_colon {txt tid} {
00799   
00800     variable mode
00801     variable command_entries
00802     
00803     # If we are in the "start" mode, bring up the command entry widget
00804     # and give it the focus.
00805     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00806       
00807       # Colorize the entry widget to match the look of the associated text widget
00808       $command_entries($txt) configure \
00809         -background [$txt cget -background] -foreground [$txt cget -foreground] \
00810         -insertbackground [$txt cget -insertbackground] -font [$txt cget -font]
00811     
00812       # Show the command entry widget
00813       grid $command_entries($txt)
00814       
00815       # Set the focus and grab on the widget
00816       grab $command_entries($txt)
00817       focus $command_entries($txt)
00818       
00819       return 1
00820       
00821     }
00822     
00823     return 0
00824     
00825   }
00826   
00827   ######################################################################
00828   # If we are in the "start" mode, move insertion cursor to the end of
00829   # the current line.  If we are in "delete" mode, delete all of the
00830   # text from the insertion marker to the end of the line.
00831   proc handle_dollar {txt tid} {
00832   
00833     variable mode
00834     
00835     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00836       $txt mark set insert "insert lineend-1c"
00837       $txt see insert
00838       return 1
00839     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "delete"} {
00840       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
00841         [ns multicursor]::delete $txt "lineend"
00842       } else {
00843         clipboard clear
00844         clipboard append [$txt get insert "insert lineend"]
00845         $txt delete insert "insert lineend"
00846       }
00847       start_mode $txt
00848       record_add "Key-dollar"
00849       record_stop
00850       return 1
00851     }
00852     
00853     return 0
00854     
00855   }
00856   
00857   ######################################################################
00858   # If we are in the "start" mode, move insertion cursor to the beginning
00859   # of the current line.  If we are in "delete" mode, delete all of the
00860   # text between the beginning of the current line and the current
00861   # insertion marker.
00862   proc handle_asciicircum {txt tid} {
00863   
00864     variable mode
00865     
00866     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00867       $txt mark set insert "insert linestart"
00868       $txt see insert
00869       return 1
00870     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "delete"} {
00871       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
00872         [ns multicursor]::delete $txt "linestart"
00873       } else {
00874         clipboard clear
00875         clipboard append [$txt get "insert linestart" insert]
00876         $txt delete "insert linestart" insert
00877       }
00878       start_mode $txt
00879       record_add "Key-asciicircum"
00880       record_stop
00881       return 1
00882     }
00883     
00884     return 0
00885 
00886   }
00887   
00888   ######################################################################
00889   # If we are in "start" mode, display the search bar.
00890   proc handle_slash {txt tid} {

00892     variable mode
00893     variable search_dir
00894     
00895     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00896       [ns gui]::search $tid "next"
00897       set search_dir($txt) "next"
00898       return 1
00899     }
00900     
00901     return 0
00902     
00903   }

00911     variable search_dir

00923   ######################################################################
00924   # If we are in "start" mode, invokes the buffered command at the current
00925   # insertion point.
00926   proc handle_period {txt tid} {
00927  
00928     variable mode
00929  
00930     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00931       set start_index [$txt index insert]
00932       playback $txt
00933       set end_index [$txt index insert]
00934       if {$start_index != $end_index} {
00935         if {[$txt compare $start_index < $end_index]} {
00936           $txt highlight $start_index $end_index
00937         } else {
00938           $txt highlight $end_index $start_index
00939         }
00940       }
00941       return 1
00942     }
00943  
00944     return 0
00945       
00946   }

00953     variable mode
00954     variable number
00955     
00956     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00957       [ns gui]::show_match_pair $tid
00958       return 1
00959     }
00960     
00961     return 0
00962     
00963   }

00965   ######################################################################
00966   # Handles the i-key when in Vim mode.
00967   proc handle_i {txt tid} {
00968     
00969     variable mode
00970     
00971     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00972       edit_mode $txt
00973       record_start
00974       return 1
00975     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "change"} {
00976       set mode($txt) "changein"
00977       return 1
00978     }
00979     
00980     return 0
00981     
00982   }

00984   ######################################################################
00985   # If we are in "start" mode, inserts at the beginning of the current
00986   # line.
00987   proc handle_I {txt tid} {
00988     
00989     variable mode
00990     
00991     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
00992       $txt mark set insert "insert linestart"
00993       edit_mode $txt
00994       record_start
00995       return 1
00996     }
00997     
00998     return 0
00999     
01000   }
01001   
01002   ######################################################################
01003   # If we are in "start" mode, move the insertion cursor down one line.
01004   proc handle_j {txt tid} {
01005   
01006     variable mode
01007     variable number
01008     variable column
01009     
01010     # Move the insertion cursor down one line
01011     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01012       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01013       lassign [split [$txt index insert] .] row col
01014       if {$column($txt) ne ""} {
01015         set col $column($txt)
01016       } else {
01017         set column($txt) $col
01018       }
01019       set row [expr {$row + (($number($txt) ne "") ? $number($txt) : 1)}]
01020       if {[$txt compare "$row.$col" < end]} {
01021         $txt mark set insert "$row.$col"
01022         adjust_insert $txt
01023         $txt see insert
01024       }
01025       return 1
01026     }
01027     
01028     return 0
01029     
01030   }
01031   
01032   ######################################################################
01033   # Performs a join operation.
01034   proc do_join {txt} {
01035     
01036     variable number
01037     
01038     set lines [expr {($number($txt) ne "") ? $number($txt) : 1}]
01039 
01040     while {$lines > 0} {
01041       
01042       # Perform a line join with the current line, trimming whitespace
01043       set line [string trimleft [$txt get "insert+1l linestart" "insert+1l lineend"]]
01044       $txt delete "insert+1l linestart" "insert+2l linestart"
01045       set index [$txt index "insert lineend"]
01046       if {$line ne ""} {
01047         $txt insert "insert lineend" " [string trimleft $line]"
01048       }
01049       
01050       incr lines -1
01051       
01052     }
01053     
01054     # Set the insertion cursor and make it viewable
01055     $txt mark set insert $index
01056     $txt see insert
01057 
01058     # Create a separator in the text history
01059     $txt edit separator
01060 
01061   }
01062 
01063   ######################################################################
01064   # If we are in "start" mode, join the next line to the end of the
01065   # previous line.
01066   proc handle_J {txt tid} {
01067 
01068     variable mode
01069 
01070     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01071       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01072         $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01073         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "+1l"
01074       } else {
01075         do_join $txt
01076         record "Key-J"
01077       }
01078       return 1
01079     }
01080 
01081     return 0
01082 
01083   }
01084 
01085   ######################################################################
01086   # If we are in "start" mode, move the insertion cursor up one line.
01087   proc handle_k {txt tid} {
01088   
01089     variable mode
01090     variable number
01091     variable column
01092     
01093     # Move the insertion cursor up one line
01094     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01095       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01096       lassign [split [$txt index insert] .] row col
01097       if {$column($txt) ne ""} {
01098         set col $column($txt)
01099       } else {
01100         set column($txt) $col
01101       }
01102       set row [expr {$row - (($number($txt) ne "") ? $number($txt) : 1)}]
01103       if {$row >= 1} {
01104         $txt mark set insert "$row.$col"
01105         adjust_insert $txt
01106         $txt see insert
01107       }
01108       return 1
01109     }
01110     
01111     return 0
01112     
01113   }

01115   ######################################################################
01116   # If we are in start mode and multicursor is enabled, move all of the
01117   # cursors up one line.
01118   proc handle_K {txt tid} {
01119     
01120     variable mode
01121     
01122     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01123       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01124       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01125         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "-1l"
01126       }
01127       return 1
01128     }
01129     
01130     return 0
01131     
01132   }
01133   
01134   ######################################################################
01135   # If we are in "start" mode, move the insertion cursor right one
01136   # character.
01137   proc handle_l {txt tid} {
01138   
01139     variable mode
01140     variable number
01141     
01142     # Move the insertion cursor right one character
01143     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01144       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01145       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01146         if {[$txt compare "insert lineend" < "insert+$number($txt)c"]} {
01147           $txt mark set insert "insert lineend"
01148         } else {
01149           $txt mark set insert "insert+$number($txt)c"
01150         }
01151         adjust_insert $txt
01152         $txt see insert
01153       } elseif {[$txt compare "insert lineend" > "insert+1c"]} {
01154         $txt mark set insert "insert+1c"
01155         adjust_insert $txt
01156         $txt see insert
01157       } else {
01158         bell
01159       }
01160       return 1
01161     }
01162     
01163     return 0
01164     
01165   }
01166   
01167   ######################################################################
01168   # If we are in "start" mode and multicursor mode is enabled, adjust
01169   # all of the cursors to the right by one character.  If we are only
01170   # in "start" mode, jump the insertion cursor to the bottom line.
01171   proc handle_L {txt tid} {
01172     
01173     variable mode
01174     
01175     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01176       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01177         $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01178         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "+1c"
01179       } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01180         $txt mark set insert @0,[winfo height $txt]
01181         adjust_insert $txt
01182         $txt see insert
01183       }
01184       return 1
01185     }
01186     
01187     return 0
01188     
01189   }
01190   
01191   ######################################################################
01192   # If we are in "start" mode, move the insertion cursor left one
01193   # character.
01194   proc handle_h {txt tid} {
01195   
01196     variable mode
01197     variable number
01198     
01199     # Move the insertion cursor left one character
01200     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01201       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01202       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01203         if {[$txt compare "insert linestart" > "insert-$number($txt)c"]} {
01204           $txt mark set insert "insert linestart"
01205         } else {
01206           $txt mark set insert "insert-$number($txt)c"
01207         }
01208         adjust_insert $txt
01209         $txt see insert
01210       } elseif {[$txt compare "insert linestart" <= "insert-1c"]} {
01211         $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
01212         adjust_insert $txt
01213         $txt see insert
01214       } else {
01215         bell
01216       }
01217       return 1
01218     }
01219     
01220     return 0
01221     
01222   }
01223   
01224   ######################################################################
01225   # If we are in "start" mode and multicursor mode is enabled, move all
01226   # cursors to the left by one character.  Otherwise, if we are just in
01227   # "start" mode, jump to the top line of the editor.
01228   proc handle_H {txt tid} {
01229     
01230     variable mode
01231     
01232     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01233       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01234         $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01235         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "-1c"
01236       } else {
01237         $txt mark set insert @0,0
01238         adjust_insert $txt
01239         $txt see insert
01240       }
01241       return 1
01242     }
01243     
01244     return 0
01245     
01246   }
01247   
01248   ######################################################################
01249   # Returns the index of the beginning next/previous word.  If num is
01250   # given a value > 1, the procedure will return the beginning index of
01251   # the next/previous num'th word.  If no word was found, return the index
01252   # of the current word.
01253   proc get_word {txt dir {num 1} {start insert}} {
01254     
01255     # If the direction is 'next', search forward
01256     if {$dir eq "next"} {
01257       
01258       # Get the end of the current word (this will be the beginning of the next word)
01259       set curr_index [$txt index "$start wordend"]
01260       
01261       # Use a brute-force method of finding the next word
01262       while {[$txt compare $curr_index < end]} {
01263         if {![string is space [$txt get $curr_index]]} {
01264           if {[incr num -1] == 0} {
01265             return [$txt index "$curr_index wordstart"]
01266           }
01267         }
01268         set curr_index [$txt index "$curr_index wordend"]
01269       }
01270       
01271       return [$txt index "$curr_index wordstart"]
01272       
01273     } else {
01274       
01275       # Get the index of the current word
01276       set curr_index [$txt index "$start wordstart"]
01277       
01278       while {[$txt compare $curr_index > 1.0]} {
01279         if {![string is space [$txt get $curr_index]] && \
01280              [$txt compare $curr_index != $start]} {
01281           if {[incr num -1] == 0} {
01282             return $curr_index
01283           }
01284         }
01285         set curr_index [$txt index "$curr_index-1c wordstart"]
01286       }
01287       
01288       return $curr_index
01289       
01290     }
01291     
01292   }
01293   
01294   ######################################################################
01295   # If we are in "start" mode, move the insertion cursor to the beginning
01296   # of previous word.
01297   proc handle_b {txt tid} {
01298     
01299     variable mode
01300     variable number
01301     
01302     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01303       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01304       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01305         $txt mark set insert [get_word $txt prev $number($txt)]
01306       } else {
01307         $txt mark set insert [get_word $txt prev]
01308       }
01309       adjust_insert $txt
01310       $txt see insert
01311       return 1
01312     }
01313     
01314     return 0
01315     
01316   }
01317   
01318   ######################################################################
01319   # If we are in "start" mode, change the state to "change" mode.  If
01320   # we are in the "change" mode, delete the current line and put ourselves
01321   # into edit mode.
01322   proc handle_c {txt tid} {
01323   
01324     variable mode
01325     
01326     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01327       set mode($txt) "change"
01328       record_start
01329       return 1
01330     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "visual"} {
01331       if {![[ns multicursor]::delete $txt "selected"]} {
01332         $txt delete sel.first sel.last
01333       }
01334       edit_mode $txt
01335       return 1
01336     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "change"} {
01337       if {![[ns multicursor]::delete $txt "line"]} {
01338         $txt delete "insert linestart" "insert lineend"
01339       }
01340       edit_mode $txt
01341       return 1
01342     }
01343     
01344     return 0
01345     
01346   }
01347   
01348   ######################################################################
01349   # If we are in "start" mode, delete from the insertion cursor to the
01350   # end of the line and put ourselves into "edit" mode.
01351   proc handle_C {txt tid} {
01352     
01353     variable mode
01354     
01355     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01356       $txt delete insert "insert lineend"
01357       edit_mode $txt
01358       return 1
01359     }
01360     
01361     return 0
01362     
01363   }
01364   
01365   ######################################################################
01366   # If we are in "change" mode, delete the current word and change to edit
01367   # mode.
01368   proc handle_w {txt tid} {
01369   
01370     variable mode
01371     variable number
01372     
01373     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01374       $txt tag remove sel 1.0 end
01375       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01376         $txt mark set insert [get_word $txt next $number($txt)]
01377       } else {
01378         $txt mark set insert [get_word $txt next]
01379       }
01380       adjust_insert $txt
01381       $txt see insert
01382       return 1
01383     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "change"} {
01384       if {($number($txt) ne "") && ($number($txt) > 1)} {
01385         if {![[ns multicursor]::delete $txt "word" $number($txt)]} {
01386           $txt delete insert "[get_word $txt next [expr $number($txt) - 1]] wordend"
01387         }
01388       } else {
01389         if {![[ns multicursor]::delete $txt " wordend"]} {
01390           $txt delete insert "insert wordend"
01391         }
01392       }
01393       edit_mode $txt
01394       return 1
01395     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "yank"} {
01396       clipboard clear
01397       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01398         clipboard append [$txt get "insert wordstart" "[get_word $txt next [expr $number($txt) - 1]] wordend"]
01399       } else {
01400         clipboard append [$txt get "insert wordstart" "insert wordend"]
01401       }
01402       start_mode $txt
01403       return 1
01404     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "delete"} {
01405       clipboard clear
01406       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01407         set word [get_word $txt next [expr $number($txt) - 1]]
01408         clipboard append [$txt get "insert wordstart" "$word wordend"]
01409         $txt delete "insert wordstart" "$word wordend"
01410       } else {
01411         clipboard append [$txt get "insert wordstart" "insert wordend"]
01412         $txt delete "insert wordstart" "insert wordend"
01413       }
01414       start_mode $txt
01415       return 1
01416     }
01417     
01418     return 0
01419     
01420   }
01421   
01422   ######################################################################
01423   # If we are in "start" mode, go to the last line.
01424   proc handle_G {txt tid} {
01425   
01426     variable mode
01427     variable number
01428     
01429     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
01430       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01431         $txt mark set insert [get_linenum $txt $number($txt)]
01432       } else {
01433         $txt mark set insert "end linestart"
01434       }
01435       adjust_insert $txt
01436       $txt see insert
01437       return 1
01438     }
01439     
01440     return 0
01441     
01442   }
01443   
01444   ######################################################################
01445   # If we are in "start" mode, transition the mode to the delete mode.
01446   # If we are in the "delete" mode, delete the current line.
01447   proc handle_d {txt tid} {
01448     
01449     variable mode
01450     variable number
01451     
01452     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01453       set mode($txt) "delete"
01454       record_start
01455       return 1
01456     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "delete"} {
01457       clipboard clear
01458       if {$number($txt) ne ""} {
01459         clipboard append [$txt get "insert linestart" "insert linestart+[expr $number($txt) - 1]l lineend"]\n
01460         $txt delete "insert linestart" "insert linestart+$number($txt)l"
01461       } else {
01462         clipboard append [$txt get "insert linestart" "insert lineend"]\n
01463         $txt delete "insert linestart" "insert linestart+1l"
01464       }
01465       start_mode $txt
01466       record_add "Key-d"
01467       record_stop
01468       return 1
01469     }
01470     
01471     return 0
01472     
01473   }
01474   
01475   ######################################################################
01476   # If we are in the "start" mode, move the insertion cursor ahead by
01477   # one character and set ourselves into "edit" mode.
01478   proc handle_a {txt tid} {
01479   
01480     variable mode
01481     
01482     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01483       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01484         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "+1c" 1 dspace
01485       }
01486       $txt mark set insert "insert+1c"
01487       edit_mode $txt
01488       record_start
01489       return 1
01490     }
01491     
01492     return 0
01493     
01494   }
01495   
01496   ######################################################################
01497   # If we are in "start" mode, insert text at the end of the current line.
01498   proc handle_A {txt tid} {
01499     
01500     variable mode
01501     
01502     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01503       $txt mark set insert "insert lineend"
01504       edit_mode $txt
01505       record_start
01506       return 1
01507     }
01508     
01509     return 0
01510     
01511   }
01512   
01513   ######################################################################
01514   # If we are in the "start" mode, set ourselves to yank mode.  If we
01515   # are in "yank" mode, copy the current line to the clipboard.
01516   proc handle_y {txt tid} {
01517   
01518     variable mode
01519     variable number
01520     
01521     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01522       set mode($txt) "yank"
01523       return 1
01524     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "visual"} {
01525       clipboard clear
01526       clipboard append [$txt get sel.first sel.last]
01527       cliphist::add_from_clipboard
01528       start_mode $txt
01529       return 1
01530     } elseif {$mode($txt) eq "yank"} {
01531       clipboard clear
01532       if {($number($txt) ne "") && ($number($txt) > 1)} {
01533         clipboard append [$txt get "insert linestart" "insert linestart+[expr $number($txt) - 1]l lineend"]\n
01534       } else {
01535         clipboard append [$txt get "insert linestart" "insert lineend"]\n
01536       }
01537       cliphist::add_from_clipboard
01538       start_mode $txt
01539       record_add "Key-y"
01540       record_stop
01541       return 1
01542     }
01543     
01544     return 0
01545     
01546   }
01547   
01548   ######################################################################
01549   # Handles a paste operation from the menu (or keyboard shortcut).
01550   proc handle_paste {txt} {
01551     
01552     variable mode
01553     
01554     if {[[ns preferences]::get Tools/VimMode] && [info exists mode($txt.t)]} {
01555       
01556       # If we are not currently in edit mode, temporarily set ourselves to edit mode
01557       if {$mode($txt.t) ne "edit"} {
01558         record_add "Key-i"
01559       }
01560       
01561       # Add the characters
01562       foreach c [split [clipboard get] {}] {
01563         record_add [utils::string_to_keysym $c]
01564       }
01565       
01566       # If we were in command mode, escape out of edit mode
01567       if {$mode($txt.t) ne "edit"} {
01568         record_add "Escape"
01569         record_stop
01570       }
01571       
01572     }
01573     
01574   }
01575   
01576   ######################################################################
01577   # Pastes the contents of the given clip to the text widget after the
01578   # current line.
01579   proc do_post_paste {txt clip} {
01580     
01581     if {[set nl_index [string last \n $clip]] != -1} {
01582       if {[expr ([string length $clip] - 1) == $nl_index]} {
01583         set clip [string replace $clip $nl_index $nl_index]
01584       }
01585       $txt insert "insert lineend" "\n$clip"
01586       $txt mark set insert "insert+1l linestart"
01587     } else {
01588       $txt insert "insert+1c" $clip
01589       $txt mark set insert "insert+[string length $clip]c"
01590     }
01591     $txt see insert
01592     
01593     # Create a marker in the text history
01594     $txt edit separator
01595     
01596   }
01597   
01598   ######################################################################
01599   # If we are in the "start" mode, put the contents of the clipboard
01600   # after the current line.
01601   proc handle_p {txt tid} {
01602   
01603     variable mode
01604 
01605     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01606       do_post_paste $txt [set clip [clipboard get]]
01607       cliphist::add_from_clipboard
01608       record "Key-p"
01609       return 1
01610     }
01611     
01612     return 0
01613     
01614   }
01615   
01616   ######################################################################
01617   # Pastes the contents of the given clip prior to the current line
01618   # in the text widget.
01619   proc do_pre_paste {txt clip} {
01620     
01621     if {[set nl_index [string last \n $clip]] != -1} {
01622       if {[expr ([string length $clip] - 1) == $nl_index]} {
01623         set clip [string replace $clip $nl_index $nl_index]
01624       }
01625       $txt insert "insert linestart" "$clip\n"
01626     } else {
01627       $txt insert "insert-1c"
01628     }
01629     
01630     # Create a marker in the text history
01631     $txt edit separator
01632     
01633   }
01634   
01635   ######################################################################
01636   # If we are in the "start" mode, put the contents of the clipboard
01637   # before the current line.
01638   proc handle_P {txt tid} {
01639   
01640     variable mode
01641 
01642     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01643       do_pre_paste $txt [set clip [clipboard get]]
01644       cliphist::add_from_clipboard
01645       record "Key-P"
01646       return 1
01647     }
01648     
01649     return 0
01650   
01651   }
01652 
01653   ######################################################################
01654   # If we are in "start" mode, undoes the last operation.
01655   proc handle_u {txt tid} {
01656   
01657     variable mode
01658     
01659     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01660       [ns gui]::undo $tid
01661       adjust_insert $txt
01662       return 1
01663     }
01664     
01665     return 0
01666     
01667   }
01668   
01669   ######################################################################
01670   # Performs a single character delete.
01671   proc do_char_delete {txt number} {
01672 
01673     if {$number ne ""} {
01674       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01675         [ns multicursor]::delete $txt "+${number}c"
01676       } elseif {[$txt compare "insert+${number}c" > "insert lineend"]} {
01677         $txt delete insert "insert lineend"
01678         if {[$txt index insert] eq [$txt index "insert linestart"]} {
01679           $txt insert insert " "
01680         }
01681         $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
01682       } else {
01683         $txt delete insert "insert+${number}c"
01684       }
01685     } elseif {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01686       [ns multicursor]::delete $txt "+1c"
01687     } else {
01688       $txt delete insert
01689       if {[$txt index insert] eq [$txt index "insert lineend"]} {
01690         if {[$txt index insert] eq [$txt index "insert linestart"]} {
01691           $txt insert insert " "
01692         }
01693         $txt mark set insert "insert-1c"
01694       }
01695     }
01696 
01697     # Create a separator in the text history
01698     $txt edit separator
01699 
01700   }
01701 
01702   ######################################################################
01703   # If we are in "start" mode, deletes the current character.
01704   proc handle_x {txt tid} {
01705   
01706     variable mode
01707     variable number
01708     
01709     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01710       do_char_delete $txt $number($txt)
01711       record_add "Key-x"
01712       record_stop
01713       return 1
01714     }
01715     
01716     return 0
01717     
01718   }

01720   ######################################################################
01721   # If we are in "start" mode, add a new line below the current line
01722   # and transition into "edit" mode.
01723   proc handle_o {txt tid} {
01724   
01725     variable mode
01726     variable number
01727     
01728     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01729       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01730         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "+1l" 1 dspace
01731       } else {
01732         $txt insert "insert lineend" "\n"
01733       }
01734       $txt mark set insert "insert+1l"
01735       $txt see insert
01736       edit_mode $txt
01737       [ns indent]::newline $txt insert
01738       record_start
01739       return 1
01740     }
01741     
01742     return 0
01743     
01744   }

01748   # and transition into "edit" mode.

01750   
01751     variable mode
01752     
01753     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01754       if {[[ns multicursor]::enabled $txt]} {
01755         [ns multicursor]::adjust $txt "-1l" 1 dspace
01756       } else {
01757         $txt insert "insert linestart" "\n"
01758       }
01759       $txt mark set insert "insert-1l"
01760       edit_mode $txt
01761       [ns indent]::newline $txt insert
01762       record_start
01763       return 1
01764     }
01765     
01766     return 0
01767     
01768   }

01802       }
01803       return 1
01804     }

01806     return 0
01807     
01808   }

01956   ######################################################################
01957   # Moves the specified bracket one word to the right.
01958   proc move_bracket_right {txt tid char} {
01959 
01960     if {[set index [$txt search -forwards -- $char insert]] ne ""} {
01961       $txt delete $index
01962       $txt insert "$index wordend" $char
01963     }
01964 
01965   }
01966   
01967   ######################################################################
01968   # Inserts or moves the specified bracket pair.
01969   proc place_bracket {txt tid left {right ""}} {
01970     
01971     variable mode
01972 
01973     # Get the current selection
01974     if {[llength [set selected [$txt tag ranges sel]]] > 0} {
01975       foreach {end start} [lreverse $selected] {
01976         $txt insert $end [expr {($right eq "") ? $left : $right}]
01977         $txt insert $start $left
01978       }
01979       return 1
01980     }
01981 
01982     # If we are in start mode, add the bracket in the appropriate place
01983     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
01984       if {($left eq "\"") || ($left eq "'")} {  
01985         set tag [expr {($left eq "'") ? "_sString" : "_dString"}]
01986         if {[lsearch [$txt tag names insert] $tag] != -1} {
01987           move_bracket_right $txt $tid $left
01988         } else {
01989           $txt insert "insert wordend"   $left
01990           $txt insert "insert wordstart" $left 
01991         }  
01992       } else {
01993         set re "(\\$left|\\$right)"
01994         if {([set index [$txt search -backwards -regexp -- $re insert]] ne "") && ([$txt get $index] eq $left)} {
01995           move_bracket_right $txt $tid $right
01996         } else {
01997           $txt insert "insert wordend"   $right
01998           $txt insert "insert wordstart" $left
01999         }
02000       }
02001       return 1
02002     }
02003 
02004     return 0
02005     
02006   }
02007   
02008   ######################################################################
02009   # If any text is selected, double quotes are placed around all 
02010   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02011   # string, the right-most quote of the completed string is moved one 
02012   # word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed within 
02013   # double-quotes.
02014   proc handle_quotedbl {txt tid} {
02015     
02016     return [place_bracket $txt $tid \"]
02017     
02018   }
02019   
02020   ######################################################################
02021   # If any text is selected, single quotes are placed around all 
02022   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02023   # single string, the right-most quote of the completed string is moved one 
02024   # word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed within 
02025   # single-quotes.
02026   proc handle_apostrophe {txt tid} {
02027     
02028     return [place_bracket $txt $tid ']
02029     
02030   }
02031   
02032   ######################################################################
02033   # If any text is selected, curly brackets are placed around all 
02034   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02035   # bracket sequence, the right-most bracket of the sequence is moved one 
02036   # word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed within 
02037   # curly brackets.
02038   proc handle_bracketleft {txt tid} {
02039     
02040     return [place_bracket $txt $tid \[ \]]
02041     
02042   }
02043   
02044   ######################################################################
02045   # If any text is selected, square brackets are placed around all 
02046   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02047   # bracket sequence, the right-most bracket of the sequence is moved one 
02048   # word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed within 
02049   # square brackets.
02050   proc handle_braceleft {txt tid} {
02051     
02052     return [place_bracket $txt $tid \{ \}]
02053     
02054   }
02055   
02056   ######################################################################
02057   # If any text is selected, parenthesis are placed around all 
02058   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02059   # parenthetical sequence, the right-most parenthesis of the sequence 
02060   # is moved one word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed 
02061   # within parenthesis.
02062   proc handle_parenleft {txt tid} {
02063     
02064     return [place_bracket $txt $tid ( )]
02065     
02066   }
02067   
02068   ######################################################################
02069   # If any text is selected, angled brackets are placed around all 
02070   # selections.  If the insertion cursor is within a completed 
02071   # bracket sequence, the right-most bracket of the sequence is moved one 
02072   # word to the end; otherwise, the current word is placed within 
02073   # angled brackets.
02074   proc handle_less {txt tid} {
02075     
02076     return [place_bracket $txt $tid < >]
02077     
02078   }
02079   
02080   ######################################################################
02081   # If we are in "start" or "visual" mode, moves the insertion cursor to the first
02082   # non-whitespace character in the next line.
02083   proc handle_Return {txt tid} {
02084     
02085     variable mode
02086     
02087     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
02088       $txt mark set insert "insert+1l linestart"
02089       if {[string is space [$txt get insert]]} {
02090         set next_word [get_word $txt next]
02091         if {[$txt compare $next_word < "insert lineend"]} {
02092           $txt mark set insert $next_word
02093         } else {
02094           $txt mark set insert "insert lineend"
02095         }
02096       }
02097       adjust_insert $txt
02098       $txt see insert
02099       return 1
02100     }
02101     
02102     return 0
02103     
02104   }
02105   
02106   ######################################################################
02107   # If we are in "start" or "visual" mode, moves the insertion cursor to the first
02108   # non-whitespace character in the previous line.
02109   proc handle_minus {txt tid} {
02110     
02111     variable mode
02112     
02113     if {($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")} {
02114       $txt mark set insert "insert-1l linestart"
02115       if {[string is space [$txt get insert]]} {
02116         set next_word [get_word $txt next]
02117         if {[$txt compare $next_word < "insert lineend"]} {
02118           $txt mark set insert $next_word
02119         } else {
02120           $txt mark set insert "insert lineend"
02121         }
02122       }
02123       adjust_insert $txt
02124       $txt see insert
02125       return 1
02126     }
02127     
02128     return 0
02129     
02130   }
02131 
02132   ######################################################################
02133   # If we are in "start" or "visual" mode, move the cursor to the given
02134   # column of the current line.
02135   proc handle_bar {txt tid} {
02136     
02137     variable mode
02138     variable number
02139     
02140     if {(($mode($txt) eq "start") || ($mode($txt) eq "visual")) && ($number($txt) ne "")} {
02141       $txt mark set insert [lindex [split [$txt index insert] .] 0].$number($txt)
02142       adjust_insert $txt
02143       $txt see insert
02144       return 1
02145     }
02146     
02147     return 0
02148     
02149   }

02151   ######################################################################
02152   # If we are in "start" mode, change the case of the current character.
02153   proc handle_asciitilde {txt tid} {
02154     
02155     variable mode
02156     
02157     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
02158       set ins  [$txt index insert]
02159       set char [$txt get insert]
02160       if {[string is lower $char]} {
02161         $txt replace insert insert+1c [string toupper $char]
02162       } else {
02163         $txt replace insert insert+1c [string tolower $char]
02164       }
02165       $txt mark set insert $ins
02166       return 1
02167     }
02168     
02169     return 0
02170     
02171   }
02172   
02173   ######################################################################
02174   # If we are in "start" mode, move the cursor to the start of the middle
02175   # line.
02176   proc handle_M {txt tid} {
02177     
02178     variable mode
02179     
02180     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
02181       $txt mark set insert @0,[expr [winfo height $txt] / 2]
02182       adjust_insert $txt
02183       return 1
02184     }
02185     
02186     return 0
02187     
02188   }
02189   
02190   ######################################################################
02191   # If we are in "start" mode, search for all occurences of the current
02192   # word.
02193   proc handle_asterisk {txt tid} {
02194     
02195     variable mode
02196     
02197     if {$mode($txt) eq "start"} {
02198       set word [$txt get "insert wordstart" "insert wordend"]
02199       catch { ctext::deleteHighlightClass [winfo parent $txt] search }
02200       ctext::addSearchClass [winfo parent $txt] search black yellow "" $word
02201       $txt tag lower _search sel
02202       gui::search_next $tid 0
02203       return 1
02204     }
02205     
02206     return 0
02207     
02208   }
